IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE INFIRMARY HEALTH SYSTEM MISSION IS LIFE WHICH MEANS EMPHASIS IS PLACED ON LEADERSHIP, INTEGRITY, FAMILY AND EXCELLENT SERVICE. OUR VISION IS THAT WE ARE THE FIRST CHOICE FOR HEALTHCARE IN OUR REGION.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE INFIRMARY HEALTH SYSTEM MISSION IS LIFE WHICH MEANS EMPHASIS IS PLACED ON LEADERSHIP, INTEGRITY, FAMILY AND EXCELLENT SERVICE. OUR VISION IS THAT WE ARE THE FIRST CHOICE FOR HEALTHCARE IN OUR REGION. THROUGHOUT INFIRMARY HEALTH SYSTEM EMPHASIS IS PLACED ON ENHANCING HEALTH AND THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR EACH MEMBER OF OUR COMMUNITY AND WE ACCOMPLISH THIS BY PROVIDING SUPPORT TO ORGANIZATIONS THAT PROMOTE HEALTH.
IRS990.Description: INFIRMARY HEALTH SYSTEM (IHS) IS THE SUPPORTING ORGANIZATION OF SIX NONPROFIT HOSPITALS, A HOSPICE, A CHARITABLE FOUNDATION, THREE OUTPATIENT FACILITIES AND 31 MEDICAL CLINICS. THROUGH THE EFFORTS OF MANAGEMENT TO PROVIDE COORDINATED SERVICES FOR ALL OPERATING DIVISIONS, ECONOMIES OF SCALE HAVE BEEN OBTAINED WHICH HAVE ALLOWED THE HOSPITALS AND CLINICS IN THE SYSTEM TO OFFER THE MOST MODERN LEVELS OF HEALTH CARE AVAILABLE AT COSTS WHICH ARE DRAMATICALLY BELOW THOSE AVERAGE COSTS AT COMPARABLE SIZED HOSPITALS IN THE REGION AND THE NATION. THE INFIRMARY HEALTH SYSTEM HAS HELPED TO INSURE THE CONTINUED PROVISION OF HOSPITAL SERVICES TO RURAL COMMUNITIES IN SOUTHWEST ALABAMA WHICH MIGHT OTHERWISE HAVE FOUND THEMSELVES WITHOUT SUCH SERVICES AVAILABLE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. THESE EFFORTS HAVE HELPED TO STABILIZE THE AVAILABILITY OF HEALTH CARE SERVICES IN THESE COMMUNITIES AND HELPED TO SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASE THE QUALITY AND SCOPE OF THE SERVICES OFFERED IN THESE COMMUNITIES. IN APRIL 2006, IHS ENTERED INTO AN AFFILIATION AGREEMENT WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTH ALABAMA (USA) BY (1) TAKING OPERATIONAL CONTROL OF TWO OF THE UNIVERSITY'S TEACHING HOSPITALS (2) DRAMATICALLY EXPANDING THE RESIDENCY AND MEDICAL STUDENT TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES AT MOBILE INFIRMARY MEDICAL CENTER AND (3) PARTICIPATING IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF A MAJOR CANCER RESEARCH CENTER WITH USA. AS A CONSEQUENCE, THE SYSTEM HAS BECOME THE PRIMARY TEACHING AFFILIATE OF THE USA MEDICAL SCHOOL AND MEDICAL RESIDENCY TRAINING PROGRAM. THE SYSTEM HAS COORDINATED EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS AND OPPORTUNITIES WITH OVER TWENTY COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES THROUGHOUT THE UNITED STATES, AFFORDING INTERNSHIP AND RESIDENCY TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES FOR PHYSICAL THERAPISTS, XRAY TECHNICIANS, REGISTERED NURSES, LICENSED PRACTICAL NURSES, AND OTHER HEALTH RELATED TECHNICAL PERSONNEL. IHS HAS FURTHER EXHIBITED ITS COMMITMENT TO THE COMMUNITY THROUGH THE EFFORTS IT HAS EXPENDED ON BEHALF OF THE AREA UNITED WAY AGENCIES AND PROGRAMS AND IN OUTREACH AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS FOR THE PEOPLE OF THE CENTRAL GULF COAST AREA. IT HAS SPONSORED NUMEROUS HEALTH CARE SEMINARS FOR THE GENERAL PUBLIC AS WELL AS FOR PHYSICIANS AND OTHER MEDICAL PERSONNEL. THE SYSTEM IS OPERATING AN ALZHEIMER'S DAY CARE CENTER, THE FIRST OF ITS KIND IN THE REGION WHICH PROVIDES A LOW COST MEDICAL MODEL RESPITE CARE SETTING FOR VICTIMS OF ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE AND SENILE DEMENTIA. THROUGH ITS SUPPORT OF THE INFIRMARY FOUNDATION, IHS HAS SHOWN ITS COMMITMENT TO ADVANCING THE PROMOTION OF HEALTH CARE EDUCATION, AND TO BRINGING NEW TECHNOLOGY AND EQUIPMENT TO THE PEOPLE SERVED BY THE MOBILE INFIRMARY MEDICAL CENTER. ALSO, THROUGH THE INFIRMARY FOUNDATION, IHS IS PROMOTING HEALTH CAREER OPPORTUNITIES TO GRADE SCHOOL AND HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS, AS WELL AS PROVIDING SCHOLARSHIPS TO NURSING AND OTHER ALLIED HEALTH STUDENTS. IHS HAS ESTABLISHED A COMMUNITY HEALTH BENEFITS FUND ADMINISTERED BY THE INFIRMARY FOUNDATION TO HELP MEET UNMET OR UNDERMET HEALTH CARE NEEDS IN THOSE AREAS WHERE WE HAVE NOT BEEN TRADITIONALLY INVOLVED. IHS FUNDS THIS INITIATIVE THROUGH A CORPORATE TITHING PROGRAM, HAVING ALREADY CONTRIBUTED APPROXIMATELY $6.4 MILLION TO THIS FUND WITH THE FUND HAVING EXPENDED A SIGNIFICANT AMOUNT OF THIS FUNDING. THE INFIRMARY HEALTH SYSTEM BOARD AND MANAGEMENT ARE COMMITTED TO APPRECIABLY ENHANCE, IN A PROACTIVE MANNER, THE HEALTHCARE STATUS AND RELATED QUALITY OF LIFE OF THE RESIDENTS OF THE COMMUNITIES WE SERVE. THROUGH OUR EFFORTS TO PROVIDE QUALITY HEALTHCARE SERVICES COMPREHENSIVELY, CONVENIENTLY AND AT THE LOWEST COST IN THE AREA, WE ARE REALIZING THAT VISION.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: HEALTH OR SOCIAL CLUB DUES SCHEDULE J, PART I, LINE 1A SOCIAL CLUB DUES ARE PAID FOR EXECUTIVES TO CARRY ON IHS BUSINESS. THESE AMOUNTS ARE PART OF THE OVERALL COMPENSATION PACKAGE AND ARE APPROVED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD. PARTICIPATED IN SUPPLEMENTAL NONQUALIFIED RETIREMENT PLAN SCHEDULE J, PART I, LINE 4B MARK NIX 94,502 JOSEPH DENTON 46,800 JIM MITCHELL 11,850 ALAN WHALEY 51,002 OWEN BAILEY 34,426 R. SANDERS 38,925 B STEVENS 20,201 W. MCLAUGHLIN 21,601 ORMOND THOMPSON 19,001 PHILIP CUSA 18,000 SHEILA DAVIDSON 18,500

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: DSCR THE PRCESS USED BY MANAGEMENT &/OR GOVERNING BODY TO REVIEW 990 FORM 990, PART VI, QUESTION 11A THE CURRENT REVIEW POLICY IS BEING REVISED AND FUTURE 990'S WILL BE REVIEWED BY THE BOARD PRIOR TO FILING. CURRENTLY THE 990 IS PREPARED BY THE ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT. A COPY OF THE FINAL 990, INCLUDING ALL REQUIRED SCHEDULES, IS PROVIDED TO THE ASSISTANT TREASURER FOR REVIEW AND THE PRESIDENT/CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL WITH SIGNATURE. THE ASSISTANT TREASURER DESCRIPTION OF PROCESS TO MONITOR TRANSACTIONS FOR CONFLICTS OF INTEREST FORM 990, PART VI, QUESTION 12C OFFICERS ARE REQUIRED ANNUALLY TO REVIEW THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY WHICH DEFINES CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AND ADVISES THAT ALL SUCH CONFLICTS SHOULD BE AVOIDED IF POSSIBLE. ALL OFFICERS ARE REQUIRED TO REPORT ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AS THEY BECOME AWARE. DIRECTORS ARE ASKED ANNUALLY TO SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT WHICH INCLUDES THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. THE DIRECTOR IS ASKED TO DISCLOSE AT THE EARLIEST POSSIBLE MEETING OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AFTER THE DIRECTOR BECOMES AWARE OF THE EXISTING OR POTENTIAL CONFLICING INTEREST. THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD MAKES THE DECISION AS TO WHETHER THERE IS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST AND WILL ALSO RESOLVE ANY CONFLICTS WITHIN THE BOARD. OFFICES & POSITIONS FOR WHICH PROCESS WAS USED, & YEAR PROCESS WAS BEGUN FORM 990, PART VI, QUESTIONS 15A & 15B THE IHS EMPLOYEES DESIGNATED AS OFFICERS, DIRECTORS AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE PARTICIPANTS IN THE ORGANIZATIONS' PERFORMANCE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM. EACH EMPLOYEE HAS AN INDIVIDUAL PERFORMANCE PLAN AND ARE REVIEWED ANNUALLY FOR MERIT INCREASES. THE ANNUAL REVIEW COVERS THE EMPLOYEE'S PERFORMANCE FOR THE FISCAL YEAR OF APRIL 1 THROUGH MARCH 31 OF THE FOLLOWING YEAR. THE AMOUNT OF INDIVIDUAL MERIT/SALARY INCREASES ARE DETERMINED BASED ON THE COMPA-RATIO (HOURLY RATE RELATIVE TO SALARY RANGE MIDPOINT), THE NUMBER OF MONTHS SINCE THEIR LAST INCREASE AND PERFORMANCE SCORE (RATING) AND THE ORGANIZATION'S ANNUAL MERIT GUIDELINES. EACH POSITION IS ASSIGNED A SALARY RANGE BASED ON THE HAY METHODOLOGY OF ACCOUNTABILITY, KNOW HOW AND PROBLEM SOLVING ABILITY. SALARY RANGE MIDPOINTS (THE MIDPOINT REPRESENTS 100% OF THE MARKET) INCREASE EACH YEAR BASED ON EXTERNAL MARKET DATA. IHS PARTICIPATES IN NUMEROUS SALARY SURVEYS. DEPENDING ON THE POSITION, THE SURVEY DATA MAY BE INDUSTRY SPECIFIC (E.G. HEALTHCARE) OR FROM OTHER INDUSTRIES. CURRENTLY, EXECUTIVE POSITION MARKET DATA COMES FROM WATSON WYATT, INTEGRATED HEALTHCARE STRATEGIES, SALARY.COM AND HAY CONSULTING. THE ANNUAL MERIT GUIDELINES ARE DETERMINED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S ABILITY TO PAY (BUDGET). THE ANNUAL MERIT GUIDELINES PROVIDE A MERIT INCREASE PERCENTAGE RANGE BASED ON THE INDIVIDUAL EMPLOYEE'S PERFORMANCE RATING AND COMPA-RATIO. FOR EXECUTIVES, THE CEO AND VP, HUMAN RESOURCES REVIEWS THE SUGGESTED MERIT INCREASE AND MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE INFIRMARY HEALTH SYSTEM COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. THE FINAL RECOMMENDATIONS PRESENTED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE ARE APPROVED BY THE IHS BOARD OF DIRECTORS. IHS HAD AN EXTERNAL REVIEW OF COMPENSATION PRACTICES PERFORMED BY WATSON WYATT IN 2008. AVAIL OF GOV DOCS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY & FIN STMT TO GEN PUBLIC FORM 990, PART VI, QUESTION 19 THE CORPORATE CHARTER OF INFIRMARY HEALTH SYSTEM IS A MATTER OF PUBLIC RECORD IN THE PROBATE COURT OF MOBILE COUNTY, AL. THE CORPORATE BYLAWS, THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE NOT MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC AT THIS TIME.
